paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The study possessed relatively low power to detect any significant association between cases and controls for low frequency and rare variants.
The study possessed relatively low power to detect any significant association between cases and controls for low frequency and rare variants.

functional_data.summary: TTR is hypothesized to act as a scaffold protein, binding to amyloid and preventing its deposition and aggregation in plaques.

variants.segregation_data: The minor allele was substantially more frequent in cases compared to controls, suggesting a possible role as a risk factor for AD.
variants.additional_notes: TTR was the main finding both in the SKAT and single-marker association analysis.
key_quotes: TTR was the main finding both in the SKAT and single-marker association analysis.
TTR is a well established biomarker for AD.

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted data was consistent and detailed regarding the TTR gene.
